column5: Aerial View Of Saskatchewan Humboldt Broncos Bus Crash Site. At that intersection there are stop signs as well as flashing red lights to warn of the intersection. Driver of the truck survived. https://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2018/0...te_a_23405664/

So are you saying you have determined it was the truckers fault? What exactly happened? Please share with us your inside knowledge. Is this a four way stop? A two way stop? If so who had the stop sign? the bus driver or the trucker? Did the bus pull in front of the trucker? I have not heard any reports as to who is at fault here, I just know it is a sad tragedy.

Its a 2 way stop with stop signs and a red flashing lights. The bus has the right away. 100% truckers fault. He has been taken into custody and awaiting a mental and psychiatric evaluation. Cell phone will be confiscated and went through as well. I hope it wasnt something as senseless as texting or facebook that caused that accident

Thanks for the information. I hope the authorities can figure a way to reduce the chances of this happening again. Still a terrible tragedy, regardless.All I get when I clicked on the earlier link was this;We Are Sorry,This video is restricted from playing in your location

I saw a overhead view of the crash site on the news. I don't know who was at fault but there was cargo scattered from the truck everywhere. My first thought was the truck got t-boned on the trailer. Like I said I don't know who was at fault but it was a horrific crash. My prayers are for all those involved.
Truck blew through the intersection hitting the bus, that has been conformed so i heard. 15 have died, was 14 earlier.It happened at highway 35 and 335 in Saskatchewan.
Dave...don't know how you read that I was pointing a finger, just an observation a buddy of mine made.
I saw the same picture. Really horrible. Such a sad thing. My thoughts and prayers to the victims and their families.
what a class move by him and his sponsor, see athttp://www.espn.com/jayski/cup/2018/story/_/id/23154108/gaunt-brothers-racing-honor-humboldt-broncos
Condolences to all those affected by the bus crash! Terrible tragedy!
Thoughts and prayers for the families and friends of those affected by the accident.
I assume a youth team? I haven't heard anything about it yet. Do you have a link for the story?
I saw this on FOX News very sad.http://www.foxnews.com/world/2018/04...-reported.html

Very sad. 1/2 the people lost their lives. Can't imagine being a parent waiting for that phone call letting you know if your child is alive. To be honest, with as many people as there are now it's a blessing there are so few of these accidents. Thoughts and prayers for all involved.

Terrible news....seems 14 dead and 14 injured. Unfortunately its not the first time and I honestly can't believe it doesn't happen more often with kids teams crossing the country on both side of the border. Not to pick on the truckers but a buddy of mine that rides the bus with his son for hockey says EVERY transport has a screen with a movie playing.

Driving the Prairie is part of living here, but it's dangerous at times. The boys on the bus in Junior Hockey spend lots of time doing it. 32 years ago it was Swift Currenthttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swift_...ncos_bus_crash

This story ruined my day, thankfully I didn't have a kid on that bus; but I have one that travels all over Canada and the north west for hockey. F$&@ Hockey. I worry non stop about the travel and the injuries. Just venting.

Ages 16-20. Much to young. Wasnt that long ago a car with teens was stopped for construction and a semi rear ended them and killed them, happened around the same area. That area has seen far to much accidents.
At the NHL game between Winnipeg Jets and Chicago Black Hawks tonight both teams had "BRONCOS" for there name bars on the jerseys for the whole game.
